revised_title: James Hartley Ashworth: A Pioneering Zoologist and Educator
tldr: James Hartley Ashworth was a renowned zoologist and educator who made significant contributions to the study of invertebrate biology, particularly in the fields of marine biology and medical zoology. He conducted extensive research on the anatomy and physiology of various invertebrates, including the Alcyonarian genus Xenia and the lug-worm Arenicola. Ashworth also played a pivotal role in establishing the first course on Medical Zoology in the UK and was instrumental in the design and establishment of a state-of-the-art laboratory in Edinburgh, which now bears his name.
